info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 5:14PM EDT until April 06 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Cumberland County in central Virginia... Central Prince Edward County in central Virginia... Northwestern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... West central Amelia County in central Virginia... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 513 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hampden Sydney, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Hampden Sydney College around 520 PM EDT. Farmville and Longwood University around 525 PM EDT. Rice around 540 PM EDT. Burkeville around 550 PM EDT. Crewe around 600 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Briery Creek Lake, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Twin Lakes State Park, Allens Mill, Rodophil, Burkes Tavern, Moran, Kingsville and Reeds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
